titleStmt.title: A DESCRIPTION of the young A-------s
CAVALCADE,

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: WHEN our Gallants are preparing
In Vacation for an Airing,
When Pease and Beans are ripe in Cods
And fit to shell from Heaps of Pods,
And Cucumbers so very plenty
You may for Two pence purchase Twenty;
When Gooseberries are ripe and full
And Currans are just fit to pull,
Then the Active young A────s
Briskly Travel on their Journies,
Some go off without delay
And Sunday think the better Day
Because Nem. Con. it is agreedThe better Day, the better Deed.
For sundry Reasons they could tell;
To bid their Duns and Friends farewell.
Then set out with borrowed Geer
For their Circuits far and near
Looking big as any Giants
On the Horses of their Clients
Like so many little Mars's
With their Tilters at their Arses
Brazen Tilters lately burnish'd,
And with Harness Buckles furnish'd,
And with Boots so very Greasy
And with Saddles Eke so easy
Saddles borrowed for a Day,
Kept for ever and for Ay.
Saddles destin'd far to Roam
Ah never to return Home.
Hats with Gold or Silver Brac'd,
Tho' by Duns and Bailiffs chac'd.
And Valleeces fine and gay
Stuff'd, instead of Shirts, with Hay,
Some accoutred like Knight Errants
Quit the Town for fear of Warrants,
Some to Cork and some to Kerry,
Others down to Londonderry.
Where they feed on Meal and Whisky
And get Drunk with Irish Isque.
Another mounts a Quadrupede
Which sometimes he's forc'd to lead.
Let him Walk or let him ride,
Charg'd with Thirteen pence a Side.
From the Hedges as he goes,
Picks off Blackberries and Sloes
While Garron feeds upon the Road,
He lyes down to take a Nod.
Empty Guts and Pockets bare,
Highway-men he does not fear.
In some Towns he is Caress'd
Thinks himself for ever bless'd.
There he toys with Farmers Spouses,
And makes Merry in their Houses.
Those who have no far'd so well,
Disappointments never tell:
Tho' they lye upon the Ground,
Where Straw nor Rushes can be found.
Wish Vacation over, then
Hey for Dublin Town again.
